docs.lead_paragraph: There are more than 4,700 hospitals in the U.S, spread about evenly between urban and rural areas. But that number has been dwindling.

headline.main: Q&A: Why Have Rural Hospitals Been Closing?
headline.print_headline: Q&A: Why Have Rural Hospitals Been Closing?

docs.snippet: There are more than 4,700 hospitals in the U.S, spread about evenly between urban and rural areas. But that number has been dwindling.

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of rural hospitals are closing their doors, forcing many Americans in small communities to travel much farther for medical care.

headline.main: Rural Hospitals Struggle to Stay Open, Adapt to Changes
headline.print_headline: Rural Hospitals Struggle to Stay Open, Adapt to Changes

docs.snippet: A growing number of rural hospitals are closing their doors, forcing many Americans in small communities to travel much farther for medical care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese-style square dancing is running circles around other hobbies for the elderly, with millions taking to parks and plazas across China, swiveling their hips and rolling their arms - but it's not to everyone's liking.

headline.main: Square Dancing Runs Circles Around Other Hobbies for China's Elderly
headline.print_headline: Square Dancing Runs Circles Around Other Hobbies for China's Elderly

docs.snippet: Chinese-style square dancing is running circles around other hobbies for the elderly, with millions taking to parks and plazas across China, swiveling their hips and rolling their arms - but it's not to everyone's liking.

docs.lead_paragraph: The joint House-Senate nonbinding budget plan promises to balance the budget in nine years through more than $5 trillion in spending cuts.

headline.main: House Passes G.O.P. Budget Aiming to Repeal Health Law

docs.snippet: The joint House-Senate nonbinding budget plan promises to balance the budget in nine years through more than $5 trillion in spending cuts.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The data, the most detailed breakdown ever provided about the prescription claims of Medicare beneficiaries, included information about 36 million patients and $103 billion in spending.

headline.main: Medicare Releases Detailed Data on Prescription Drug Spending
headline.print_headline: Medicare Releases Detailed Data on Prescription Drug Spending

docs.abstract: Government officials release most detailed report to date on Medicare spending, revealing intricate picture of 36 million patients and $103 billion in total expenditures; heartburn medication Nexium, which accounted for largest spending on single drug, was prescribed to 1.5 million patients at total cost of $2.5 billion; officials express hope that deluge of information will yield useful analysis as experts weigh in.
docs.snippet: The data, the most detailed breakdown ever provided about the prescription claims of Medicare beneficiaries, included information about 36 million patients and $103 billion in spending.

byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen and Griff Palmer contributed reporting.
byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: For $1.3 million, a foreigner can obtain a Maltese passport, residency with tax advantages and freedom to move throughout the European Union.

headline.main: Malta Offers Citizenship and All Its Perks for a Price
headline.print_headline: Malta Citizenship and Perks for a Price

docs.abstract: New residency requirements have only increased controversy surrounding Malta's citizenship program, which offers passport to those willing to pay 1.2 million euros, or $1.3 million; rules require applicants to rent property in country for 12 months, but not to actually reside there; critics say nation is selling citizenship only to global elite, creating haven with tax advantages and freedom to travel throughout the European Union.
docs.snippet: For $1.3 million, a foreigner can obtain a Maltese passport, residency with tax advantages and freedom to move throughout the European Union.

docs.lead_paragraph: Claims for state unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to a seasonally adjusted 262,000 for the week ended April 25, the lowest reading since April 2000, the Labor Department said.

headline.main: U.S. Jobless Claims Hit 15-Year Low; Consumer Spending Rises
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Fall Sharply; Consumer Spending Rises

docs.abstract: Labor Department reports that weekly applications for unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to seasonally adjusted 262,000, lowest reading in 15 years.
docs.snippet: Claims for state unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to a seasonally adjusted 262,000 for the week ended April 25, the lowest reading since April 2000, the Labor Department said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A look at where Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont stands on key issues as he seeks the Democratic presidential nomination.

headline.print_headline: Senator’s Position on Major Campaign Issues Could Push Clinton to the Left

docs.abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders, who is seeking presidential nomination as Democrat, stands far to the left of rival Hillary Clinton on major campaign issues, like foreign policy, immigration and health care.
docs.snippet: A look at where Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont stands on key issues as he seeks the Democratic presidential nomination.
